title: microformats2 h-event
description: h-event is the microformats2 vocabulary for marking up an event post on web sites. h-event is often used with both event listings and individual event pages.

examples.name: Microformats Meetup
examples.summary: Get together and discuss all things microformats-related.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Duration, formatted according to RFC 3339 (to use in u-audio, u-video).

end.title: Date
end.description: Date formatted according to ISO 8601 or RFC 3339.

anyOf.title: Date with time zone (RFC 3339)
anyOf.description: Date-time formatted according to RFC 3339 (time-zone is mandatory).

anyOf.title: Full date-time string (ISO 8601)
anyOf.description: Represents a full date-time string in the ISO 8601 format (time zone is optional).

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the entry, event, item, product, etc (to use in h-entry, h-event, h-item, h-product, h-recipe, h-review, h-review-aggregate).

start.title: Date
start.description: Date formatted according to ISO 8601 or RFC 3339.

anyOf.title: Date with time zone (RFC 3339)
anyOf.description: Date-time formatted according to RFC 3339 (time-zone is mandatory).

anyOf.title: Full date-time string (ISO 8601)
anyOf.description: Represents a full date-time string in the ISO 8601 format (time zone is optional).

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: Summary of an entry (to use in h-entry, h-recipe, h-resume).

url.title: URL
url.description: URL of the card, entry, event, etc.
